entityNames.ff_x_wall_cables: Large Horizontal Inside Wall with Cables
entityNames.inwalll90cables: Large Vertical Inside Wall with Cables
entityNames.label: Label

entityDescriptions.hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be 'inside the sub'. Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
entityDescriptions.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
entityDescriptions.waypoint: Used by AI characters to navigate inside the submarine.
entityDescriptions.spawnpoint: Determines which rooms the crew spawns inside.
entityDescriptions.ff_x_wall: A large horizontal wall with collision detection.
entityDescriptions.ff_x_wall_cables: A large horizontal wall with collision detection.
entityDescriptions.ff_y_wall: A large vertical wall with collision detection.
entityDescriptions.inwalll90cables: A large vertical wall with collision detection.
entityDescriptions.largehorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.smallhorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.largeverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.largeverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.smallverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.smallverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection.
entityDescriptions.cableholderhorizontal: Decorative strip for stowing wires neatly.
entityDescriptions.cableholdervertical: Decorative strip for stowing wires neatly.
entityDescriptions.largeplatform: Walkable platform that a character may optionally drop down from or climb on.
entityDescriptions.platform: Walkable platform which a character may optionally drop down from or climb on.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallhorizontal: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallvertical: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallheavyhorizontal: A heavy wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallheavyvertical: A heavy wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallhorizontalsmall: A small wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinwallverticalsmall: A small wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinback: A back wall for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinbackcarvings: A back wall with carved symbols for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinbackfractal: A back wall with fractal pattern for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinblock: A decorative prop for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinclaw: A decorative prop for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.door: A sliding door with no integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
entityDescriptions.windoweddoor: A sliding door with a window. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
entityDescriptions.hatch: A door, but on the horizontal axis. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually.
entityDescriptions.doorwbuttons: A sliding door with two integrated buttons.
entityDescriptions.windoweddoorwbuttons: A sliding door with a window and two integrated buttons.
entityDescriptions.hatchwbuttons: A door, but on the horizontal axis. Two integrated buttons.
entityDescriptions.navterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the sub.
entityDescriptions.shuttlenavterminal: Usable device for setting the course of the shuttle.
entityDescriptions.sonarmonitor: Usable device for observing the sub's sonar. Non-interactive.
entityDescriptions.statusmonitor: Usable device for viewing a schematic of the sub as well as the status of each room.
entityDescriptions.sonartransducer: Sonar generator, allowing the sonar monitors and navigation terminals to receive a sonar signal other than the default one (useful for drones and remote-controlled shuttles).
entityDescriptions.engine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
entityDescriptions.largeengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
entityDescriptions.shuttleengine: Usable device for generating motion on the X axis.
entityDescriptions.fabricator: A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials.
entityDescriptions.medicalfabricator: A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines.
entityDescriptions.deconstructor: Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars.
entityDescriptions.oxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
entityDescriptions.shuttleoxygenerator: Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks.
entityDescriptions.vent: Oxygen output point. Must be linked to an oxygen generator to work.
entityDescriptions.reactor1: Usable device for generating electrical power.
entityDescriptions.coilgun: A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies.
entityDescriptions.coilgunloader: Feeds coilgun ammunition into a linked coilgun.
entityDescriptions.depthchargetube: Deploys a depth charge or decoy.
entityDescriptions.depthchargeloader: Feeds depth charges and decoys into a linked depth charge tube.
entityDescriptions.dischargecoil: Produces a harmful localized electrical shock across a portion of the adjacent hull.
entityDescriptions.railgun: A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets.
entityDescriptions.periscope: A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun.
entityDescriptions.railgunloader: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun.
entityDescriptions.railgunloadersinglevertical: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
entityDescriptions.railgunloadersinglehorizontal: Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
entityDescriptions.coilgunammoshelf: A way to neatly stow ammunition boxes.
entityDescriptions.idcard: Allows limited access to areas of the sub.
entityDescriptions.alienpistol: A handgun powered by alien power cells.
entityDescriptions.captainscap: A token of the captain's unquestionable authority.
entityDescriptions.captainsuniform: Makes you look like you might be in charge.
entityDescriptions.healthscanner: A heads-up display that shows information about the vital signs and status of nearby humans.
entityDescriptions.doctorsuniform2: Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency.
entityDescriptions.orangejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
entityDescriptions.bluejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
entityDescriptions.toolbox: A portable container for storing tools and supplies.
entityDescriptions.headset: Allows remote communication among the crew.
entityDescriptions.watchmanclothes: Makes you look like you might offer a mission to a passerby at any moment.
entityDescriptions.bodyarmor: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
entityDescriptions.ballistichelmet1: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
entityDescriptions.divingmask: Small enough to carry around in case it's needed, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.
entityDescriptions.divingsuit: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust. Only offers adequate protection up to the depth of 4,000 meters - beyond this point, an Abyss or Combat suit is required..
entityDescriptions.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.
entityDescriptions.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.
entityDescriptions.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
entityDescriptions.weldingtool: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.
entityDescriptions.plasmacutter: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.
entityDescriptions.screwdriver: Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible.
entityDescriptions.crowbar: Forces doors and hatches open. Also a blunt weapon.
entityDescriptions.sonarbeacon: Produces a localized signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal.
entityDescriptions.flare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.
entityDescriptions.alienflare: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare.
entityDescriptions.coilgunammoboxexplosive: Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact.
entityDescriptions.coilgunammoboxpiercing: Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities.
entityDescriptions.coilgunboltexplosive: Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact.
entityDescriptions.coilgunboltpiercing: Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities.
entityDescriptions.uex: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.
entityDescriptions.ic4block: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.
entityDescriptions.detonator: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.
entityDescriptions.spear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
entityDescriptions.alienspear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material.
entityDescriptions.explosivespear: A harpoon for the harpoon gun.
entityDescriptions.harpoongun: Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons.
entityDescriptions.syringegun: Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons.
entityDescriptions.stungrenade: Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters.
entityDescriptions.fraggrenade: General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully.
entityDescriptions.stunbaton: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a stun baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission.
entityDescriptions.batterycell: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.
entityDescriptions.fulguriumbatterycell: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.
entityDescriptions.alienarmor: A body armor fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
entityDescriptions.alienhelmet: A helmet fabricated from an alien metamaterial.
entityDescriptions.flamer: An incendiary weapon that fires a stream of burning welding fuel.
entityDescriptions.smgmagazine: A magazine for .45 caliber SMG rounds.
entityDescriptions.grenadelauncher: A portable grenade launcher for 40mm grenades.
entityDescriptions.shotgun: A shotgun designed for crowd control.
entityDescriptions.stungun: A device for firing electrified darts.
entityDescriptions.stungundart: Causes electric shock to incapacitate a target. Non-lethal.
entityDescriptions.crawlermask: Protects wearer's identity. Fun at certain parties.
entityDescriptions.shellshield: A sturdy piece of a moloch's shell.
entityDescriptions.mudraptorshell: A protective shell of a mudraptor.
entityDescriptions.bongodrums: An old handmade pair of bongo drums.
entityDescriptions.captainspipe: For calming the nerves when the sea is stormy.
entityDescriptions.physicoriumammobox: Coilgun ammunition made of alien material.
entityDescriptions.orangejumpsuit1: Has a protective lead shielding against radiation.
entityDescriptions.captainscap1: A well-worn cap that has seen many ports.
entityDescriptions.captainsuniform1: A warm jacket to protect its wearer against the cold depths.
entityDescriptions.captainscap2: Strikes fear into the hearts of the Coalition.
entityDescriptions.securityuniform1: I ain't got time to bleed.
entityDescriptions.ballistichelmet2: A bit lighter than a regular ballistic helmet; designed not to get in the way when one is operating a periscope.
entityDescriptions.ballistichelmet3: Designed for crowd control but equally useful against alien invaders.
entityDescriptions.doctorsuniform1: For frontline medics. Offers some protection against enemies.
entityDescriptions.baseballcap: Every self-respecting mechanic should have one.
entityDescriptions.duffelbag: The traditional way of storing a deceased seafarer's belongings until they can be delivered to their next of kin (or stolen or sold).
entityDescriptions.outpostoutfit1: Not much to look at, but pretty warm and comfortable.
entityDescriptions.sprayer: Cleans or paints walls by spraying liquid on them.
entityDescriptions.spearunique: An antique spear named after a legendary captain.
entityDescriptions.divingknifeunique: For friends and enemies alike. Mostly enemies.
entityDescriptions.smgunique: A tactical weapon, available in black and slightly darker black.
entityDescriptions.flamerunique: Gets rid of pests like nothing else. Patent pending.
entityDescriptions.clownmaskunique: Nothing remains hidden under mother's gaze.
entityDescriptions.clownsuitunique: Nothing can escape mother's warm embrace.
entityDescriptions.toolbelt: A wearable container for storing tools and supplies.
entityDescriptions.chitinhelmet: A tough helmet made of chitin.
entityDescriptions.glowstick: Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub.
entityDescriptions.junctionbox: Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices.
entityDescriptions.battery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
entityDescriptions.shuttlebattery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
entityDescriptions.chargingdock: A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock.
entityDescriptions.fpgacircuit: Field-programmable gate array—a multipurpose circuit that can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.
entityDescriptions.andcomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.
entityDescriptions.addercomponent: Outputs the sum of the received signals.
entityDescriptions.orcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receives a signal.
entityDescriptions.notcomponent: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.
entityDescriptions.relaycomponent: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.
entityDescriptions.delaycomponent: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.
entityDescriptions.equalscomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal.
entityDescriptions.greatercomponent: Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input.
entityDescriptions.colorcomponent: Outputs a combined color signal for light control.
entityDescriptions.subtractcomponent: Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals.
entityDescriptions.multiplycomponent: Outputs the product of the received signals.
entityDescriptions.dividecomponent: Outputs the divided value of the received signals.
entityDescriptions.xorcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal.
entityDescriptions.memorycomponent: Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored.
entityDescriptions.oxygendetector: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.
entityDescriptions.waterdetector: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.
entityDescriptions.smokedetector: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.
entityDescriptions.motiondetector: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.
entityDescriptions.signalcheckcomponent: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.
entityDescriptions.regexcomponent: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.
entityDescriptions.oscillator: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.
entityDescriptions.wificomponent: Allows remote communication between other wifi components that are using the same channel.
entityDescriptions.camera: Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub.
entityDescriptions.button: Produces a signal that can be used to toggle the state of equipment and doors.
entityDescriptions.switch: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.
entityDescriptions.emergencylight: Wall-mounted lighting. Requires no electrical input.
entityDescriptions.wire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.redwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.bluewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.orangewire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.greenwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.blackwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.brownwire: Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another.
entityDescriptions.lightcomponent: General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input.
entityDescriptions.emergencysiren: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
entityDescriptions.alarmbuzzer: Can be triggered to make a terrible noise.
entityDescriptions.beacon: When deployed and activated in the correct location, it will signal colonists to come and set up an outpost.
entityDescriptions.sincomponent: Outputs the sine of the input.
entityDescriptions.coscomponent: Outputs the cosine of the input.
entityDescriptions.tancomponent: Outputs the tangent of the input.
entityDescriptions.asincomponent: Outputs the angle whose sine is equal to the input.
entityDescriptions.acoscomponent: Outputs the angle whose cosine is equal to the input.
entityDescriptions.atancomponent: Outputs the angle whose tangent is equal to the input. If the "signal_in_x" and "signal_in_y" connections are used, the input is interpreted as a vector and the angle calculated using Atan2.
entityDescriptions.modulocomponent: Outputs the remainder when the input is divided by a specific number.
entityDescriptions.roundcomponent: Rounds a numerical input to the nearest integer value.
entityDescriptions.ceilcomponent: Outputs the smallest integer value that is bigger than or equal to the input.
entityDescriptions.floorcomponent: Outputs the greatest integer value that is less than or equal to the input.
entityDescriptions.factorialcomponent: Outputs the factorial of the input.
entityDescriptions.squarerootcomponent: Outputs the square root of the input.
entityDescriptions.abscomponent: Outputs the absolute value of the input.
entityDescriptions.powcomponent: Outputs the input raised to a given power.
entityDescriptions.lever: Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors.
entityDescriptions.concatcomponent: Joins the inputs together and outputs the joined value (for example, the inputs "mud" and "raptor" would output "mudraptor").
entityDescriptions.alienblood: Blood extracted from a Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
entityDescriptions.huskeggs: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'.
entityDescriptions.carbon: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.
entityDescriptions.iron: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.
entityDescriptions.tin: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.
entityDescriptions.lead: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.
entityDescriptions.phosphorus: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.
entityDescriptions.copper: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.
entityDescriptions.zinc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.
entityDescriptions.sodium: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine. Reacts violently when coming into contact with water.
entityDescriptions.silicon: Used as an ingredient in aluminum alloys, plastic and various electrical components.
entityDescriptions.uranium: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
entityDescriptions.potassium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
entityDescriptions.magnesium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
entityDescriptions.lithium: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs.
entityDescriptions.chlorine: Most commonly used in saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.
entityDescriptions.slimebacteria: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.
entityDescriptions.titanite: A mineral containing titanium and iron.
entityDescriptions.brockite: A mineral containing thorium and phosphorus.
entityDescriptions.amblygonite: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminum and sodium.
entityDescriptions.sphalerite: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.
entityDescriptions.quartz: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.
entityDescriptions.diamond: A crystal composed of solid carbon.
entityDescriptions.hydroxyapatite: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.
entityDescriptions.uraniumore: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.
entityDescriptions.stannite: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.
entityDescriptions.esperite: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.
entityDescriptions.galena: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.
entityDescriptions.langbeinite: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.
entityDescriptions.chamosite: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminum.
entityDescriptions.ironore: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.
entityDescriptions.polyhalite: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.
entityDescriptions.sylvite: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.
entityDescriptions.lazulite: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.
entityDescriptions.opium: A relatively mild opioid obtained from aquatic poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.
entityDescriptions.antibiotics: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of minor organ damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
entityDescriptions.stabilozine: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be used to slow down the effects of most toxins.
entityDescriptions.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.
entityDescriptions.sulphuricacid: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.
entityDescriptions.antidama1: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
entityDescriptions.antidama2: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
entityDescriptions.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.
entityDescriptions.antibloodloss2: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
entityDescriptions.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and, to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
entityDescriptions.calyxanide: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.
entityDescriptions.antinarc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate-based withdrawal and overdose.
entityDescriptions.morbusineantidote: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.
entityDescriptions.cyanideantidote: An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning.
entityDescriptions.sufforinantidote: An antidote for acute sufforin poisoning.
entityDescriptions.deliriumineantidote: An antidote for acute deliriumine poisoning.
entityDescriptions.antirad: Slows down cellular degradation caused by radiation.
entityDescriptions.liquidoxygenite: A mildly toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.
entityDescriptions.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.
entityDescriptions.steroids: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.
entityDescriptions.hyperzine: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.
entityDescriptions.chloralhydrate: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
entityDescriptions.nitroglycerin: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
entityDescriptions.fiberplant: This plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.elastinplant: The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.aquaticpoppy: It's warm to the touch. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.yeastshroom: The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.elastin: A highly elastic, naturally occurring protein. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.adrenaline: A naturally occurring hormone. Useful for crafting.
entityDescriptions.antiparalysis: A cure for paralysis. Beware: Excessive use may cause psychosis.
entityDescriptions.hallucinogenicbufotoxin: Hallucinogenic toxin secreted by some Europan species. Serves as an antiparalysant in a pinch.
entityDescriptions.petegg: A strange egg. Try injecting it with saline.
entityDescriptions.food: The best food for your slimy friend.
entityDescriptions.swimbladder: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.
entityDescriptions.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
entityDescriptions.suppliescabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
entityDescriptions.mediumsteelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
entityDescriptions.mediumwindowedsteelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
entityDescriptions.steelcabinet: Storage for small- and medium-sized items.
entityDescriptions.securesteelcabinet: Lockable storage for small- and medium-sized items.
entityDescriptions.railgunshellrack: A way to neatly stow railgun shells.
entityDescriptions.divingsuitlocker: A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit.
entityDescriptions.metalcrate: A vessel in which items may be stored.
entityDescriptions.securemetalcrate: A secure vessel in which items may be stored.
entityDescriptions.explosivecrate: A vessel in which explosives may be stored.
entityDescriptions.chemicalcrate: A vessel in which chemicals may be stored.
entityDescriptions.extinguisherbracket: Holds a fire extinguisher to the wall.
entityDescriptions.weaponholder: A place to stow your weapons neatly.
entityDescriptions.dockingport: A vertically aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking port to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
entityDescriptions.dockinghatch: A horizontally aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking hatch to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations.
entityDescriptions.ductblock: A mechanically operated vent that may be opened or closed to allow the passage of water.
entityDescriptions.label: Decorative text label.
entityDescriptions.fuelrod: A bar of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor.
entityDescriptions.fulguriumfuelrod: A bar of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
entityDescriptions.thoriumfuelrod: A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods.
entityDescriptions.depthchargeshell: A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode.
entityDescriptions.nucleardepthcharge: A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode.
entityDescriptions.depthdecoyshell: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
entityDescriptions.nucleardepthdecoy: A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub.
entityDescriptions.nuclearshell: A nuclear shell for use with a railgun.
entityDescriptions.mudraptoregg: A slimy, pulsating mudraptor egg. The gaping maw on top of the egg seems to be grasping for something to eat.
entityDescriptions.loosevent: A place to stash things of dubious nature.
entityDescriptions.loosepanel: A place to stash things of dubious nature.
entityDescriptions.handheldterminal: A handheld device used for storing messages.
entityDescriptions.idcardwreck: This ID card allows access to most of the wreck, provided the door isn't rusted shut.
entityDescriptions.outpostterminal: Allows access to the outpost's digital services.
entityDescriptions.sealedsupplycrate: A box of various in-demand supplies. Fetches a high price at outposts.
entityDescriptions.scrap: A pile of possibly useful material.
entityDescriptions.spinelingspike: A detached bone spike that once belonged to a Spineling.
entityDescriptions.mediccrate: A box for medical items and ingredients.
entityDescriptions.alientrinket1: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.alientrinket2: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.alientrinket3: Minor artifact found in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.alienhatch: A horizontal hatch for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.aliendoor: A vertical door for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.alienmotionsensor: A motion detector used by aliens.
entityDescriptions.aliengenerator: Converts alien power cells to electricity.
entityDescriptions.alienpump: Used to pump water in and out of ruins.
entityDescriptions.alienbutton: Sends a signal to alien mechanisms.
entityDescriptions.alienturret: A stationary turret found in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.aliencoil: Discharges electricity; used in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.alienlightcomponent: Emits light; used in alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.smallplanter: Suitable for most Europan plantlife while small enough to be transported around by hand.
entityDescriptions.fertilizer: Carefully tended Europan soil guaranteed to give your plant the best living conditions.
entityDescriptions.seedbag: Can store a wide variety of seeds.
entityDescriptions.wateringcan: Keeps your plants happy and alive.
entityDescriptions.creepingorange: A tasty fruit. Its processed juice has minor healing properties.
entityDescriptions.tobaccobud: Damp and strongly fragrant. Can be refined into serviceable pipe tobacco.
entityDescriptions.raptorbane: It looks delicious, but should not be ingested under any circumstances. Not good for mudraptors.
entityDescriptions.raptorbaneextract: Concentrated raptorbane juice. Mildly toxic for humans, catastrophically toxic for mudraptors.
entityDescriptions.pomegrenadeextract: Concentrated pomegrenade juice. It offers minor healing properties.
entityDescriptions.pipetobacco: Put it in your pipe and smoke it.
entityDescriptions.rustdecal: Decorative decal for walls and machines
entityDescriptions.abyssdivingsuit: A heavy suit designed for deep sea exploration. Protects against damage and high pressure all the way down to 10,000 meters, reduces oxygen usage, but at a cost of reduced movement speed.
entityDescriptions.combatdivingsuit: An agile, lightweight suit designed for combat. Offers some protection against damage and withstands pressure up to the depth of 6,000 meters.
entityDescriptions.turrethardpoint: An empty weapon station turrets can be installed on.
entityDescriptions.unitloaddevice: A container that can hold a large quantity of crates.
entityDescriptions.railguncanistershell: A reloadable burst-type munition for the railgun.
entityDescriptions.railguncanistershellpellet: A pellet fired out of a canister shell.
entityDescriptions.pulselaser: A large pulsed chemical laser attached to a turret, capable of firing intense beams of energy after charging up. Inflicts extreme burns on anything it hits.
entityDescriptions.pulselaserammobox: A box of arranged chemicals and a focusing lens, useful for inducing intense bursts of energy. Used as ammo by the Pulse Laser.
entityDescriptions.chaingun: A powerful multiple-barrel turreted weapon, based on coilgun technology. Though somewhat unwieldy and slow to wind up to its firing state, its capability to deliver a hail of high-velocity metal at any would-be foe is unparalleled.
entityDescriptions.chaingunammobox: A heavy box of ammo for the Chaingun.
entityDescriptions.piratehelmet: A set of body armor, partially fashioned out of improvised materials by the pirates. It's heavier than it looks.
entityDescriptions.chaingunammoboxphysicorium: A backbreakingly heavy box of ammunition for the chaingun, utilizing Physicorium as its main material. These rounds have enough stopping power to occasionally stun any foe they hit.
entityDescriptions.pulselaserammoboxtrilaser: A box of containing a special concoction of chemicals and rare materials. The lens used splits the laser in three, allowing the laser to hit multiple targets at once.
entityDescriptions.pirateclothes: A rugged outfit hand-crafted by the pirates, designed to endure the harsh conditions of seabound life on Europa. This specific outfit has been improved with light armor plating.
entityDescriptions.unidentifiedgeneticmaterial: A mass of alien genetic material. Use a research station to identify the material and to process it into something that can be inserted into a gene splicer.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialmudraptor: Causes the subject to grow a mudraptor-like beak.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialmoloch: Increases resistance to physical damage by [value]%
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialthresher: Decreases the subject's oxygen consumption by [value]%.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialmantis: Increases movement speed on land by [value]%.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialhammerhead: Allows the subject to to do [value]% more damage with melee weapons.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialhammerheadmatriarch: Makes the subject's physical injuries heal at a rate of [value]% per minute.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialspineling: Causes the subject to grow spineling-like bony protrusions out of their back.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialhusk: Prevents husk infections from advancing to the point where the parasite takes control of the host.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialmollusc: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain [value]% vigor.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialskitter: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain [value]% hyperactivity.
entityDescriptions.geneticmaterialhunter: Receiving physical damage makes the subject gain a [value]% boost to melee weapon damage.
entityDescriptions.genesplicer: A device used to splice alien genes into a human. Equip the splicer in the health interface and insert genetic materials in the splicer to activate the genes. Once spliced onto a living subject, genetic material cannot be removed without destroying it.
entityDescriptions.advancedgenesplicer: A more advanced form of the gene splicer, capable of activating two types of genetic materials at the same time.
entityDescriptions.gravitysphere: Generates a strong, artificial gravity field.
entityDescriptions.pressurestabilizer: A special drug that gives the user an immunity to pressure and removes their need for oxygen for a short duration.
entityDescriptions.endocrinebooster: This medical contraption, when used, bestows the user with permanent performance enhancement.
entityDescriptions.slipsuit: A modified Combat Diving Suit with additional diving fins that aid the user when moving in water. Sadly, the fins also make it difficult to walk on solid ground.
entityDescriptions.bandolier: A light combat rig, capable of carrying ammunition and other useful items. Thanks to improved ergonomics, increases combat effectiveness with ranged weapons and turrets.
entityDescriptions.repairpack: A handheld contraption, capable of quickly correcting mechanical and electrical problems. Consumed on use.
entityDescriptions.autoinjectorheadset: A modifed headset utilizing an integrated battery, capable of injecting medicine placed within once the user's vitals drop to a certain level.
entityDescriptions.depletedfuel: A heavy, hard material derived from processing a spent fuel rod. Can be further fabricated into tools and munitions.
entityDescriptions.wrenchhardened: A wrench that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.
entityDescriptions.screwdriverhardened: A screwdriver that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for more efficient repairs and heavier swings.
entityDescriptions.crowbarhardened: A crowbar that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material makes it easier to pry open doors and bash open heads.
entityDescriptions.divingknifehardened: A diving knife that has gone through a process of hardening using depleted fuel. The strengthened material allows for deeper slashes and stabs.
entityDescriptions.revolverrounddepletedfuel: A .38 round for the revolver, fashioned out of depleted fuel. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
entityDescriptions.smgmagazinedepletedfuel: A .45 caliber magazine for the SMG, containing rounds of depleted fuel ammo. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
entityDescriptions.coilgunammoboxdepletedfuel: A heavy box of depleted fuel ammunition for the coilgun. Along with increased penetration, the ammo has been special-made to also inflict radiation sickness on the target.
entityDescriptions.handheldelectricalmonitor: A small handheld device that gives the user remote access to information regarding the ship's electrical systems.
entityDescriptions.handheldstatusmonitor: A small handheld device with a screen displaying the current status of the ship, informing the user of any breaches remotely.
entityDescriptions.autoshotgun: A roughly engineered automatic shotgun with a vast ammo capacity. Its size and heft makes it a bit cumbersome to lug around.
entityDescriptions.handcannon: A humongous beast of a revolver, designed to better deal with the large alien threats on Europa than typical firearms.
entityDescriptions.handcannonround: An exceedingly large .61 revolver round. The unique alloy of materials allows for high penetration and stopping power.
entityDescriptions.coalitioncommendation: A small medal fashioned out of copper by the Coalition. When applied to another crewmember's body, it instantly bestows them with a sum of experience.
entityDescriptions.coalitionmedal: A small medal fashioned out of bronze by the Coalition. Much like a Coalition Commendation, it bestows another crewmember with experience, except in greater amounts.
entityDescriptions.assaultrifle: An assault rifle chambering 6.8mm cartridges. Though banned by the Coalition, the schematics for these rifles are still passed around Europa as they present a premier option for submarine defense, or as the Separatists would prefer, societal revolution.
entityDescriptions.assaultriflemagazine: A magazine designed for holding 6.8mm cartridges.
entityDescriptions.shotgunslugexplosive: A shotgun slug containing explosive material. Powerful, but still somewhat inaccurate on account of being fired out of a shotgun.
entityDescriptions.skillbooksailorsguide: A small handbook that covers all the tasks associated with underwater sailing, though in limited scope.
entityDescriptions.skillbooksubmarinewarfare: A small handbook with useful information pertaining to all things submarine warfare, with detailed pictures of elaborate tactical manuevers and proper firearms discipline.
entityDescriptions.skillbookhandyseaman: A small handbook containing detailed information on the most-often-encountered technical problems on board the submarines of Europa, with simple-to-understand instructions for dealing with them.
entityDescriptions.skillbookeuropanmedicine: A small handbook seeking to educate its reader on the proper conduct with treating the wounded and the sick using limited medical resources. The word "triage" appears to be mentioned a lot.
entityDescriptions.thermalgoggles: A thermal imaging device that makes it easier to distinguish living targets in poor lighting conditions, even through solid obstacles.
entityDescriptions.reactorpda: A handheld device that can be used to remotely control the submarine's reactor.
entityDescriptions.dirtybomb: An explosive compound mixed with highly radioactive material. Though the explosive payload is low, the ensuing fallout will catastrophically irradiate the area.
entityDescriptions.fulguriumfuelrodvolatile: A Fulgurium fuel rod that has been further refined to supply power for much longer than normal. However, its radiation shielding can only partially limit the emitted ambient radiation, so the rod must be handled with care.
entityDescriptions.nucleargun: A prototype energy weapon built using the unique alien materials on Europa. The weapon induces a type of fission reaction at the end of the barrel, and releases it in a powerful beam once it is too violent to contain.
entityDescriptions.cargoscooter: An underwater scooter special-made to transport material underwater. While the scooter is too large to be stored in one's inventory, its inherent buoyancy means the scooter will stay where you leave it.
entityDescriptions.clowndivingmask: A clown mask combined with a diving mask, allowing the user to both clown around and breathe underwater.
entityDescriptions.safetyharness: A special harness made to reduce workplace related injuries incurred on Europan submarines. The harness also dampens the effects of rushing water, stabilizing the user in the event of a hull breach.
entityDescriptions.pucs: The Protective Universal Crisis Suit, or PUCS for short, bestows its user with immense resistances to environmental hazards such as radiation and fire. The built-in air-filtration system allows the suit to utilize hull oxygen when possible, and the built-in computer injects the user with whatever medicine is placed inside the suit.
entityDescriptions.cigar: A submariner's life is mentally taxing, but perhaps this exquisitely crafted cigar can help you soothe your nerves a bit.
entityDescriptions.stungundartfulgurium: A highly potent stun gun dart that will drop any would-be creep like a sack of potatoes.
entityDescriptions.fixfoamgrenade: Emits a cloud of chemical sealant that quickly seals off leaks.
entityDescriptions.portablepump: A small battery-powered pump that can be installed on walls. Pumps out water very fast, but consumes a lot of power.
entityDescriptions.dementonitetool: Fabricated from the poorly understood alien material dementonite. Holding it evokes a strange sense of unease.
entityDescriptions.alienterminal: Sends signals if the required item is contained.
entityDescriptions.artifacttransportcase: A case to ease the transportation of alien artifacts.
entityDescriptions.RuinWallCorner1: A basic wall with collision for alien ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinscanner: A device that uses sonar waves to map ruins.
entityDescriptions.ruinvent: A vent that might emit harmful spores or gas.
entityDescriptions.boardingaxe: A hand axe, meant to be wielded with both hands.
entityDescriptions.supercapacitor: Can output huge surges of power, but has a much lower capacity than batteries. Recharging the capacitors also takes much more power than batteries.
entityDescriptions.combatstimulantsyringe: A highly advanced stimulant that makes the user rapidly recover from physical injuries and bloodloss.

afflictionDescriptions.internaldamage: There are signs of burst blood vessels and of organ damage.
afflictionDescriptions.bleeding: Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound.
afflictionDescriptions.burn: The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets. The patient is in a great deal of pain.
afflictionDescriptions.oxygenlow: The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue.
afflictionDescriptions.bloodloss: The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
afflictionDescriptions.stun: The patient is dazed and unresponsive.
afflictionDescriptions.pressure: There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze.
afflictionDescriptions.huskinfection: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
afflictionDescriptions.psychosis: The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events.
afflictionDescriptions.drunk: The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus.
afflictionDescriptions.opiatewithdrawal: Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea.
afflictionDescriptions.opiateoverdose: The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow.
afflictionDescriptions.opiateaddiction: The patient is happy enough...so long as they get what they need.
afflictionDescriptions.gunshotwound: The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound, however, is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue, and it's pouring blood.
afflictionDescriptions.morbusinepoisoning: The patient can't breathe at all, and their heart rate is slowing rapidly.
afflictionDescriptions.sufforinpoisoning: Without prompt treatment, sufforine poisoning leads to delusions and rapid death.
afflictionDescriptions.cyanidepoisoning: The patient is confused and has trouble breathing. Their skin is red and they have occasional muscle spasms.
afflictionDescriptions.blunttrauma: The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken.
afflictionDescriptions.lacerations: The skin is pierced and there are deep, bleeding wounds.
afflictionDescriptions.bitewounds: There is extensive damage to soft tissue in the area and there are asymmetrical, bleeding wounds.
afflictionDescriptions.radiationsickness: The patient's skin is red and blistering.
afflictionDescriptions.deliriuminepoisoning: The patient seems agitated, with small but noticeable nervous twitches in their face and hands.
afflictionDescriptions.organdamage: The patient is suffering from sharp pain in their internal organs. There is no visible damage to the epidermis.
afflictionDescriptions.explosiondamage: The area is colored purple. The tissue underneath feels different than the surrounding skin.
afflictionDescriptions.nausea: The skin is clammy and the patient is vomiting periodically.
afflictionDescriptions.watchersgaze: Seeming confused and slightly terrified, the patient doesn't look good. Could it be a mental breakdown? A stress reaction? There's not much you can do about it.
afflictionDescriptions.reaperstax: The patient is tormented by painful visions of death and rebirth. Memories of past lives or just a stress reaction...? Consulting a medical doctor at an outpost is advised.
afflictionDescriptions.concussion: The patient seems disoriented and has trouble focusing their eyes.
afflictionDescriptions.haste: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
afflictionDescriptions.huskinfectionresistance: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites.
afflictionDescriptions.pressureresistance: Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures.
afflictionDescriptions.paralysisresistance: The patient's body is less affected by paralysis. It also seems to recover from any existing effects.
afflictionDescriptions.increasedswimmingspeed: Oxygen flows more freely into the subject's limbs, resulting in greater swimming speed.
afflictionDescriptions.naturalmeleeweapon: A sharp beak is protruding from the subject's forehead.
afflictionDescriptions.naturalrangedweapon: Sharp spikes are growing from the subject's back.
afflictionDescriptions.damageresistance: Subject's skin is hardened and more resistant to damage.
afflictionDescriptions.decreasedoxygenconsumption: Subject's lung capacity is grown, resulting in more efficient oxygen consumption.
afflictionDescriptions.increasedwalkingspeed: Subject's bone structure is lighter, resulting in greater walking and running speed.
afflictionDescriptions.increasedmeleedamage: Subject has gained muscle mass, resulting in greater strength.
afflictionDescriptions.healdamage: Subject's wounds are healed at an accelerated rate.
afflictionDescriptions.vigorondamage: Subject's pain receptors are numbed in response to physical trauma.
afflictionDescriptions.hyperactivityondamage: Subject's reflexes are heightened in response to physical trauma.
afflictionDescriptions.increasedmeleedamageondamage: Subject's adrenaline level is heightened in response to physical trauma.
afflictionDescriptions.husktransformimmunity: Subject has gained a heightened tolerance for the husk parasite.
afflictionDescriptions.tunnelvision: Subject's eyes are sensitive to light.
afflictionDescriptions.rigidjoints: Subject's joints are stiff and moving is more difficult.
afflictionDescriptions.hypersensitivity: Subject's skin is sore and more sensitive to touch.
afflictionDescriptions.xenobiology: Subject's organs are resistant to traditional medicine.
afflictionDescriptions.outsideinfluence: Subject hears unintelligible voices inside their head.
afflictionDescriptions.glassjaw: Subject suffers from longer periods of unconsciousness when knocked out.
afflictionDescriptions.musculardystrophy: Subject suffers from decreased muscle mass.
afflictionDescriptions.inflamedlung: Subject has an adverse reaction to oxygen.
afflictionDescriptions.regeneration: The subject is slowly regaining their vitality.
afflictionDescriptions.repairflow: The subject is in the flow, and able to repair devices effortlessly.
afflictionDescriptions.evasivemaneuvers: The subject has momentarily become a much better captain.
afflictionDescriptions.stonewall: The subject has become sturdier and resistant to stuns.
afflictionDescriptions.clownpower: Only by wearing the mask is the true self revealed.
afflictionDescriptions.soothingsounds: The sounds of clownery have a healing effect on the subject.
afflictionDescriptions.inspiringtunes: The subject's skills are momentarily increased.
afflictionDescriptions.tandemfire: The subject is gaining combat effectiveness from being near an inspiring ally.
afflictionDescriptions.tumbling: The subject's effectiveness with pistols is increased.
afflictionDescriptions.quickdrawing: The subject is prepared to draw.
afflictionDescriptions.dashing: The subject is moving forward, quickly.
afflictionDescriptions.inspiredtoact: The subject, ordered by their captain, has become stalwart and able!
afflictionDescriptions.welldrilled: The subject, ordered by their captain, has become better at ship repairs and maintenance.
afflictionDescriptions.battleready: The subject, ordered by their captain, is now a much better warrior.
afflictionDescriptions.downwiththeship: The subject refuses to abandon ship, and will do anything to restore it to its former glory.
afflictionDescriptions.powerattack: The subject is about to unleash a powerful attack.
afflictionDescriptions.pickinguptheslack: The subject feels they must work a bit harder to make up for someone else.
afflictionDescriptions.pyromania: The subject is enjoying the smell of searing flesh a bit too much.
afflictionDescriptions.tinkerexhaustion: The subject can't tinker with any more devices for the time being.
afflictionDescriptions.bedsidemanner: The subject is gaining physical damage reduction and is learning faster.
afflictionDescriptions.guarded: The subject is prepared for the next attack on them.
afflictionDescriptions.skillfulmelodies: The subject has become better at learning.
afflictionDescriptions.chemaddiction: The patient has grown dependent on performance-boosting drugs.
afflictionDescriptions.chemwithdrawal: The patient sweats and twitches a lot, likely craving their next fix.
afflictionDescriptions.pressurestabilized: The subject is immune to pressure and has no need for oxygen at this time.
afflictionDescriptions.endocrineboost: The subject has gained heightened capabilities, permanently.
afflictionDescriptions.spaceherpes: The patient's face is covered with nasty-looking blisters and ulcers.
afflictionDescriptions.invertcontrols: The patient's eyes are darting around and they seem to be having trouble orienting to their surroundings.
afflictionDescriptions.implacable: The subject is unable to fall unconscious.
